1.text: What then shall we say? Shall we continue in sin, that grace might abound.

2.text: It may not be. We who died to sin, shall we yet live in it?

3.text: Or know ye not, that as many of us as were immersed in Christ Jesus, we were immersed into his death?

4.text: Therefore were we buried with him by immersion into death: that as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, so also we should walk in newness of life.

5.text: For if grown together we have been in the likeness of his death, but also shall we be of the resurrection:

6.text: Knowing this, that our old man was crucified together, that the body of sin might be left inactive, for us no more to serve sin.

7.text: For he having died was justified from sin.

8.text: And if we died with Christ, we believe we shall also live with him:

9.text: Knowing that Christ, raised from the dead, dies no more; death has no more power over him.

10.text: For he who died, died to sin once: but he who lives, lives to God.

11.text: So also ye reckon yourselves truly to be dead to sin, and living to God in Christ Jesus our Lord.

12.text: Therefore let not sin reign in your mortal body, to listen to it in its passions.

13.text: Neither present ye your members weapons of injustice to sin: but present yourselves to God, as living from the dead, and your members weapons of justice to God.

14.text: For sin shall not rule over you: for ye are not under law, but under grace.

15.text: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under law, but under grace It may not be.

16.text: Know ye not, that to whom ye present yourselves servants for obedience, ye are servants to whom ye listen; either of sin to death, or of obedience to justice?

17.text: And grace to God, that ye were servants of sin, but ye listened from the heart to the type of teaching in which ye were delivered.

18.text: And freed from sin, ye were subdued to justice.

19.text: (I speak as man through the weakness of your flesh:) for as ye presented your members to uncleanness and iniquity; so now present ye your members servants to justice for consecration.

20.text: For when ye were servants to sin, ye were free to justice.

21.text: Therefore what fruit had ye then of what ye are now ashamed? for the end of these, death.

22.text: And now freed from sin, and subdued to God, ye have your fruit to consecration, and the end life eternal.

23.text: For the purchasing the provisions of sin, death; and the grace of God, life eternal in Christ Jesus our Lord.
